algorithm_technique: Iterate through all combinations of columns using bitmasks and check row coverage.
problem_summary_simple: Select columns to cover the maximum number of rows with 1s.
problem_summary_technical: Select `numSelect` columns to maximize rows where all 1s in the row correspond to selected columns.
key_insights: The small constraints on `m` and `n` (<= 12) suggest a solution involving iterating through subsets of columns.
Representing rows as bitmasks allows for efficient checking of coverage when a set of columns is selected.
The `next_popcount` function is a clever way to iterate through all combinations of `numSelect` columns efficiently.
